SEARCH
Module csc.edu.taskgenerator2
Package csc.edu.taskgenerator2

Class Task

java.lang.Object
csc.edu.taskgenerator2.Task
public class Task extends Object
CSC2040 Final Project - TaskGenerator 11/15/2024
Author:
ChrisGiere The Task class sets the parameters for a Task Object. The three components being a date (LocalDate), a task (String), and a status (String).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Task()
    Base constructor taking no parameters.

    Task(javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<LocalDate> date, javafx.beans.property.StringProperty task, javafx.beans.property.StringProperty status)
    This overloaded constructor is used to pull in tasks from the task list file.

  • Constructor Details

    • Task

      public Task()
      Base constructor taking no parameters.

    • Task

      public Task(javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<LocalDate> date, javafx.beans.property.StringProperty task)
      Overloaded constructor setting a ObjectProperty<LocalDate> and StringProperty for a Task object. Here the date is formatted in the way it is represented on the TableView.
      Parameters:
      date - - A ObjectProperty<LocalDate> is used so that a date will appear in TableView.
      task - - A StringProperty is used so that a task can be added to the TableViewe.

    • Task

      public Task(javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<LocalDate> date, javafx.beans.property.StringProperty task, javafx.beans.property.StringProperty status)
      This overloaded constructor is used to pull in tasks from the task list file. The third parameter status is needed as statuses are already set on the file, if there are any tasks to be added.
      Parameters:
      date - - A ObjectProperty<LocalDate> is used so that a date will appear in TableView.
      task - - A StringProperty is used so that a task can be added to the TableView.
      status - - A StringProperty is used so that the status can be shown in the table.

  • Method Details

    • getDate

      public javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<LocalDate> getDate()
      This getter method returns a given Task's date.
      Returns:
      ObjectProperty<LocalDate> date returned.

    • getTask

      public javafx.beans.property.StringProperty getTask()
      This getter method returns a given Task's task description.
      Returns:
      StringProperty for a task description.

    • getStatus

      public javafx.beans.property.StringProperty getStatus()
      This getter method returns a given Task's status.
      Returns:
      StringProperty for a given Task's status.

    • writeToFile

      public void writeToFile()
      This method returns void as its purpose is to have the current Task List in the TableView written to the file via the BufferedWriter and FileWriter classes. Provides error message if tasks can not be written to file.

    • readFile

      public void readFile()
      This method returns void as it is reading a file into the Primary Controller's TaskList which will be added to the TableView. The BufferedReader and FileReader classes are used to achieve this. An error message yields if an IOException or DateTimeParseException occurs.
      Throws:
      DateTimeParseException - if error occurs in parsing a LocalDate.

    • deleteTaskFromFile

      public static void deleteTaskFromFile(javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<LocalDate> date, javafx.beans.property.StringProperty taskDescription)
      Method is used to delete a line matching a specific task and date in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      date - - A ObjectProperty<LocalDate> is used for the task to be deleted.
      taskDescription - - A StringProperty is used for the task to be deleted.
